definition[0]: a change in the direction or use of something, or the act of changing it
example[1]: the diversion of funds into the military budget
definition[1]: an enjoyable activity that you do to stop yourself from becoming bored
definition[2]: something that stops you from paying attention to what you are doing or what is happening
example[2]: Two prisoners created a diversion to give the men time to escape.
definition[3]: a different way that traffic is sent when the usual roads are closed
definition[4]: when money stops being spent in one area of business or on one type of product, and starts being spent on another
example[3]: a diversion of resources away from the competitive export market
